00278 static const char* Copyright= "(C) Copyright Michigan State University 2002, All rights reserved";/*
00279 ** Facility:
00280 **   Xamine MOTIF C++ support.
00281 ** Abstract:
00282 **   XMMenus.cc   - This file contains method code to support the XMMenus
00283 **                  classes.  These class allows the client to construct
00284 **                  menu items a bit more easily than direct motif calls.
00285 **                  Methods for the following  classes are present:
00286 **                             XMPulldown - Pulldown menu.
00287 **                             XMMenuBar  - Menu bar class.
00288 ** Author:
00289 **   Ron Fox
00290 **   NSCL
00291 **   Michigan State University
00292 **   East Lansing, MI 48824-1321
00293 ** Version information:
00294 **    @(#)XMMenus.cc    8.1 6/23/95 
00295 */
00296 
00297 /*
00298 ** Include files:
00299 */
00300 #include <stdio.h>
00301 #include <Xm/Separator.h>
00302 #include "XMMenus.h"

00305 ** Declarations:
00306 */

00309              void exit(int);
00310            }

00312 
00313 /*
00314 ** Method description:
00315 **    BuildMenu   - This private method builds a pulldown menu.
00316 **                  At this point, nothing has been done since we've invoked
00317 **                  the default constructor of the XMManaged widget which
00318 **                  just copies the widget name.
00319 ** Formal Parameters:
00320 **    Cardinal max_items:
00321 
00322 **      The maximum number of items in the menu.  This includes buttons,
00323 **      submenus and yes, even separators.
00324 **    Widget parent:
00325 **      The parent widget for the menu... this should either be another menu
00326 **      or a menu bar.
00327 **    ArgList l:
00328 **      A posibly null argument list of resource modifiers.
00329 **    Cardinal num_args:
00330 **      A possibly zero number entries in l.
00331 */
00332 void XMPulldown::BuildMenu(Cardinal max_items, Widget parent,
00333                            ArgList l, Cardinal num_args)
00334 {
00335 
00336   /* Attempt to get the required storage: */
00337 
00338   if(max_items == 0) {
00339     fprintf(stderr, "Error from XMPulldown constructor... max_items = 0\n");
00340     exit(-1);
00341   }
00342   menu_count     = 0;
00343   max_menu_items = max_items;
00344   menu_items = new XMMenuItem[max_items];
00345   if(menu_items == NULL) {
00346     fprintf(stderr, "Error from XMPulldown constructor...%s\n",
00347             "Unable to allocate menu_items");
00348     exit(-1);
00349   }
00350   for(int i = 0; i < max_menu_items; i++) {
00351     menu_items[i].item = NULL;
00352     menu_items[i].type = Unused;
00353   }
00354 
00355   /* Create the pulldown menu: */
00356 
00357   id = XmCreatePulldownMenu(parent, name, l, num_args);
00358 
00359   /* Now we create a cascade button which is linked to the pulldown via 
00360   ** the XmNsubMenuId resource.
00361   */
00362   pd_button = new XMCascadeButton(name, parent);
00363   pd_button->Label(name);
00364   pd_button->SetAssociatedMenu(id);
00365   pd_button->SetMnemonic(name[0]);
00366                         
00367   if(pd_button == NULL) {
00368     fprintf(stderr,
00369          "XMPulldown constructor error...Could not make new cascade button\n");
00370   }
00371 }
00372 
00373 /*
00374 ** Method Description:
00375 **   ~XMPulldown      - Destructor for the pulldown menu class.
00376 **                      We must destroy the cascade button widget as well
00377 **                      as all the widgets in the menu list.
00378 */
00379 XMPulldown::~XMPulldown()
00380 {
00381   delete pd_button;             /* Destroy the cascade button. */
00382 
00383 
00384   /* Destroy all the widgets and submenus: */
00385 
00386   for(int idx = 0; idx < menu_count; idx++) {
00387     XMManagedWidget *mw;
00388     XMPushButton    *pb;
00389     XMToggleButton  *tb;
00390     XMPulldown      *pd;
00391     switch(menu_items[idx].type) {
00392     case Unused:
00393       break;
00394     case Separator:
00395       mw = (XMManagedWidget *)menu_items[idx].item;
00396       delete mw;
00397       break;
00398     case Button:
00399       pb = (XMPushButton *)menu_items[idx].item;
00400       delete pb;
00401       break;
00402     case ToggleButton:
00403       tb = (XMToggleButton *)menu_items[idx].item;
00404       delete tb;
00405       break;
00406     case Submenu:
00407         pd = (XMPulldown *)menu_items[idx].item;
00408       delete pd;
00409       break;
00410     default:
00411       fprintf(stderr,
00412               "Error in XMMenu destructor... invalid item type\n");
00413       break;
00414     }
00415   }
00416   /* Destroy the book keeping storage: */
00417 
00418   delete []menu_items;
00419 
00420 }
00421 
00422 /*
00423 ** Method Description:
00424 **   XMPulldown::AddMenuButton    - This method adds a pushbutton menu entry to the
00425 **                      pulldown menu.  This is done at the end of the
00426 **                      current list of menu items.
00427 ** Formal Parameters:
00428 **   char *n:
00429 **     Name of the button, also used as the label string.
00430 **   void (*callback)(XMWIdget, XtPointer, XtPointer):
00431 **     Callback to be associated with the activation of the button.
00432 **     NULL for no callback.
00433 **   XtPointer client_data:
00434 **     Possibly null client data for the callback.
00435 **   ArgList l:
00436 **     Possibly null argument list of resource overrides for the pushbutton.
00437 **     Most commonly used to set up the button mnemonic, or to control the
00438 **     initial sensitivity of the button.
00439 **   Cardinal num_args:
00440 **     Possibly zero argument list size.  
00441 */
00442 XMPushButton *XMPulldown::AddMenuButton(char *n, 
00443                                         void (*callback)(XMWidget *, 
00444                                                          XtPointer,
00445                                                          XtPointer),
00446                                         XtPointer client_data,
00447                                         ArgList l,
00448                                         Cardinal num_args)
00449 {
00450   XMPushButton *pb;
00451   /*  First ensure that there's room: */
00452 
00453   if(menu_count >= max_menu_items) {
00454     fprintf(stderr,
00455             "Error in XMPulldown::AddmenuButton - Maximum menu size exceeded\n"
00456             );
00457     exit(-1);
00458   }
00459   menu_items[menu_count].item = pb = new XMPushButton(n,
00460                                                       *this,
00461                                                       callback,
00462                                                       client_data);
00463   if(pb == NULL) {
00464     fprintf(stderr,
00465             "Error in XMPulldown::AddmenuButton - unable to new pushbutton\n");
00466     exit(-1);
00467   }
00468   /*  Set the item list properties: */
00469 
00470   for(int i = 0; i < num_args; i++) {
00471     pb->SetAttribute(l[i].name, l[i].value);
00472   }
00473   menu_items[menu_count].type = Button;
00474 
00475   /* Count one more entry and return the widget object pointer. */
00476 
00477   menu_count++;
00478   return pb;
00479 }
00480 
00481 /*
00482 ** Method Description:
00483 **   XMToggleButton *XMPulldown::AddMenuToggleButton  - 
00484 **                                          This function adds a toggle button
00485 **                                          to the pulldown menu.
00486 ** Formal Parameters:
00487 **   char *n:
00488 **     Name of the button and default label.
00489 **   void (*callback)(XMWidget *, XtPointer, XtPointer):
00490 **     Pointer to the callback or NULL If there isn't to be one.
00491 **   XtPointer client_data:
00492 **     Call back function client data or NULL if there isn't any.
00493 **   ArgList l:
00494 **     Possibly NULL set of override resources.
00495 **   Cardinal num_args:
00496 **     Possibly zero count of override resources
00497 ** Returns:
00498 **    Pointer to toggle button widget object.
00499 */
00500 XMToggleButton *XMPulldown::AddMenuToggleButton(char *n, 
00501                                                 void (*callback)(XMWidget *,
00502                                                                  XtPointer,
00503                                                                  XtPointer),
00504                                                 XtPointer client_data,
00505                                                 ArgList l, 
00506                                                 Cardinal num_args)
00507 {
00508   XMToggleButton *pb;
00509   /*  First ensure that there's room: */
00510 
00511   if(menu_count >= max_menu_items) {
00512     fprintf(stderr,
00513             "Error in XMPulldown::AddmenuToggleButton - Maximum menu size exceeded\n"
00514             );
00515     exit(-1);
00516   }
00517   menu_items[menu_count].item = pb = new XMToggleButton(n,
00518                                                         *this,
00519                                                         callback,
00520                                                         client_data);
00521   if(pb == NULL) {
00522     fprintf(stderr,
00523             "Error in XMPulldown::AddmenuButton - unable to new pushbutton\n");
00524     exit(-1);
00525   }
00526   /*  Set the item list properties: */
00527 
00528   for(int i = 0; i < num_args; i++) {
00529     pb->SetAttribute(l[i].name, l[i].value);
00530   }
00531   menu_items[menu_count].type = ToggleButton;
00532 
00533   /* Count one more entry and return the widget object pointer. */
00534 
00535   menu_count++;
00536   return pb;
00537 }
00538                                                 
00539 
00540 /*
00541 ** Method Description:
00542 **   XMPulldown::AddSeparator   - This method adds a separator object to a menu.
00543 **                    A separator looks like a horizontal line that spans the
00544 **                    width of the menu.
00545 ** Returns:
00546 **   Pointer to the created object widget.
00547 */
00548 XMWidget *XMPulldown::AddSeparator()
00549 {
00550   XMManagedWidget *sep;
00551   char n[30];
00552 
00553   /* Make sure there's room: */
00554 
00555   if(menu_count >= max_menu_items) {
00556     fprintf(stderr,
00557             "Error in XMPullDown::AddSeparator. Too many menu items\n");
00558     exit(-1);
00559   }
00560 
00561   /* Now create the widget: */
00562 
00563   sprintf(n, "Sep_%d", menu_count);
00564   menu_items[menu_count].item = sep = 
00565                                 new XMManagedWidget(n,
00566                                                     xmSeparatorWidgetClass,
00567                                                     *this);
00568   if(sep == NULL) {
00569     fprintf(stderr,
00570             "Error in XMPullDown::AddSeparator.. Failed new XMManagedWidget\n");
00571     exit(-1);
00572   }
00573   /* Set the entry type and return to the caller: */
00574 
00575   menu_items[menu_count].type = Separator;
00576   menu_count++;
00577 
00578   return sep;
00579 
00580 }
00581 
00582 /*
00583 ** Method Description:
00584 **    XMPulldown::AddSubmenu  - This method adds a submenu to the parent
00585 **                              menu.  The submenu is a pull right menu.
00586 **                              This is done by creating a new Pulldown
00587 **                              with 'this' as the parent.
00588 ** Formal Parameters:
00589 **   char *n:
00590 **     Pulldown name and button label.
00591 **   int size:
00592 **     Maximum number of items in the menu
00593 **   ArgList l:
00594 **     Possibly null list of resource modifiers.
00595 **   Cardinal num_args:
00596 **     Possibly zero count of the argument list.
00597 ** Returns:
00598 **   Pointer to the created widget object.
00599 */
00600 XMPulldown *XMPulldown::AddSubmenu(char *n, int size, ArgList l, Cardinal num_args)
00601 {
00602   XMPulldown *pd;
00603 
00604   /* Check that we won't be exceeding bounds on menu size: */
00605 
00606   if(menu_count >= max_menu_items) {
00607     fprintf(stderr,
00608             "Error in XMPulldown::AddSubmenu - menu size exceeded\n");
00609     exit(-1);
00610   }
00611   /*  Generate the new pulldown: */
00612 
00613   menu_items[menu_count].item = pd = 
00614                                 new XMPulldown(n, *this, size, l, num_args);
00615   if(pd == NULL) {
00616     fprintf(stderr,
00617             "Error in XMPulldown::AddSubmenu - new XMPulldown failed\n");
00618     exit(-1);
00619 
00620   }
00621   /* Set type, increment the size and return the pulldown */
00622 
00623   menu_items[menu_count].type = Submenu;
00624   menu_count++;
00625 
00626   return pd;
00627 }
00628 
00629 /*
00630 ** Method Description:
00631 **    XMPulldown::FindMenuItem  - Locates a menu item in a Pulldown.
00632 **                                If there are descendents submenus,
00633 **                                they too are searched.  Note that the
00634 **                                name could be that of a submenu legally.
00635 ** Formal Parameters:
00636 **   char *n:
00637 **     Name of the item to find.
00638 ** Returns:
00639 **   Pointer to the entry located or
00640 */
00641 XMMenuItem *XMPulldown::FindMenuItem(char *n)
00642 {
00643   XMMenuItem *here, *found;
00644 
00645   here = menu_items;
00646   for(int i = 0; i < menu_count; i ++,here++) {
00647     XMPulldown *sm;
00648     switch(here->type) {
00649     case Unused:
00650       break;                    /* No associated widget. */
00651     case Separator:
00652     case Button:
00653     case ToggleButton:
00654       if(strcmp(n, here->item->getname()) == 0)
00655         return here;
00656       break;
00657     case Submenu:               /* Search recursively: */
00658       {
00659         sm = (XMPulldown *)here->item;
00660         found = sm->FindMenuItem(n);
00661         if(found) return found;
00662       }
00663       break;
00664     default:
00665       fprintf(stderr,
00666               "Error XMPulldown::FindMenuItem invalid menu item type\n");
00667       exit(-1);
00668     }
00669   }
00670   return NULL;
00671 }
00672 
00673 /*
00674 ** Method Description:
00675 **    XMPulldown::GetNextMenuItem   - This function returns the next menu
00676 **                                   item in an interative retrieval.
00677 ** Returns:
00678 **   Pointer to the menu entry or NULL if at the end of the list.
00679 */
00680 XMMenuItem *XMPulldown::GetNextMenuItem()
00681 {
00682   XMMenuItem *here;
00683 
00684   if(menu_cursor < menu_count) {
00685     here = &menu_items[menu_cursor];
00686     menu_cursor++;
00687   }
00688   else {
00689     here = NULL;
00690   }
00691   return here;
00692 }
00693 
00694 /*
00695 ** Method Description:
00696 **    XMMenuBar::mbCreate     - This method is used by the creation
00697 **                              operators (constructors) of the menubar class.
00698 **                              We do the following:
00699 **                                Initialize attribute values.
00700 **                                Allocate storage for the menubar book-keeping
00701 **                                   fields.
00702 **                                Create the menubar widget.
00703 **                             Note, while we inherit from XMManagedWidget,
00704 **                             we have not yet been created as the constructor
00705 **                             has called a null constructor which has only copied
00706 **                             the widget name into the name field.
00707 ** Formal Parameters:
00708 **  Widget parent:
00709 **     Parent widget id.
00710 **  Cardinal num_menus:
00711 **     Maximum number of pull down menus the bar will support.
00712 **  ArgList l:
00713 **     Possibly null list of resource overrides.
00714 **  Cardinal num_args:
00715 **     Possibly zero count of elements in l.
00716 */
00717 typedef XMPulldown *pdpointer;
00718 void  XMMenuBar::mbCreate(Widget parent, Cardinal num_menus, ArgList l,
00719                           Cardinal num_args)
00720 {
00721   /* Initialize the attribute fields */
00722 
00723   menu_count = 0;
00724   max_menu_items = num_menus;
00725   help_pulldown = NULL;         /* No help pulldown yet. */
00726 
00727   /* Allocate storage for the pulldown list: */
00728 
00729   menu_items = new pdpointer[max_menu_items];
00730   if(menu_items == NULL) {
00731     fprintf(stderr,
00732             "XMMenuBar constructor error.. could not allocate menu list\n");
00733     exit(-1);
00734   }
00735   for(int i = 0; i < max_menu_items; i++)
00736     menu_items[i] = NULL;
00737 
00738   /* Create the menu bar: */
00739 
00740   id = XmCreateMenuBar(parent, name, l, num_args);
00741 
00742 }
00743 
00744 /*
00745 ** Method Description:
00746 **   ~XMMenuBar   - Destructor for the menu bar class.
00747 **                  We must delete all the pulldowns that have been
00748 **                  added and we must free the storage taken up by the
00749 **                  pulldown widget list.
00750 */
00751 XMMenuBar::~XMMenuBar()
00752 {
00753   
00754 
00755   /* Kill the pulldowns: */
00756 
00757   for(int i = 0; i < max_menu_items; i++) {
00758     delete menu_items[i];
00759   }
00760   delete []menu_items;          /* Kill the pointer storage. */
00761 
00762   /* The managed widget destructor will take care of killing the menubar
00763   ** widget
00764   */
00765 }
00766 
00767 /*
00768 ** Method Description:
00769 **   XMMenuBar::AddPulldown - This method adds a pulldown menu to a menu bar.
00770 **                            If there is a free element in the widget list,
00771 **                            a pulldown is dynamically created and added
00772 **                            to the list. 
00773 ** Formal Parameters:
00774 **   char *n:
00775 **     Name of the pulldown menu -- will also wind up being the menu label.
00776 **   int max_items:
00777 **     Number of items in the menu.
00778 **   ArgList l:
00779 **     Possibly null set of resource overrides for the pulldown menu widget.
00780 **     Note to override the cascade button widget resources, you must get
00781 **     the cascade button widget and then SetAttributes on it.
00782 **   Cardinal num_args:
00783 **     Possibly zero argument list count.
00784 ** Returns:
00785 **   A pointer to the pulldown menu object so that the user can stock it
00786 **   with menu entries.
00787 **/
00788 
00789 XMPulldown *XMMenuBar::AddPulldown(char *n, int max_items,
00790                                    ArgList l, Cardinal num_args)
00791 {
00792   XMPulldown *pd;
00793 
00794   /*  Check to see that we have room for the new kid: */
00795 
00796   if(menu_count >= max_menu_items) {
00797     fprintf(stderr,
00798             "XMMenuBar::AddPulldown - Menu bar size exceeded\n");
00799     exit(-1);
00800   }
00801 
00802   /* Create and add the new pulldown: */
00803 
00804   menu_items[menu_count] = pd = 
00805                               new XMPulldown(n, *this, max_items, l, num_args);
00806   if(pd == NULL) {
00807     fprintf(stderr,
00808             "XMMenuBar::AddPulldown - Pulldown creation failed\n");
00809     exit(-1);
00810   }
00811 
00812   /* Update the count and return the widget: */
00813 
00814   menu_count++;
00815   return pd;
00816 }
00817 
00835 XMPulldown *XMMenuBar::AddHelpPulldown(char *n, int max_items,
00836                                        ArgList l, Cardinal num_args)
00837 {
00838   if(help_pulldown) {           /* Attempting second help menu */
00839     fprintf(stderr,
00840             "XMMenuBar::AddHelpPulldown--attempted to add second pulldown \n");
00841     exit(-1);
00842   }
00843   help_pulldown = AddPulldown(n, max_items, l, num_args); /* It's a pulldown */
00844   if(help_pulldown == NULL) {
00845     fprintf(stderr,
00846             "XMMenuBar::AddHelpPulldown - Add of help pulldown failed\n");
00847     exit(-1);
00848   }
00849   SetAttribute(XmNmenuHelpWidget, help_pulldown->GetCascadeButton()->getid());
00850 
00851   return help_pulldown;
00852 }
00853 
00854 /*
00855 ** Method Description:
00856 **   XMMenuBar::GetPulldown   - Returns a pointer to a named pulldown object
00857 **                               or NULL if there isn't a match
00858 ** Formal Parameters:
00859 **   char *n:
00860 **     The name of the pulldown sought.
00861 ** Returns:
00862 **    Pointer to the pulldown or NULL if there is no match.
00863 */
00864 XMPulldown *XMMenuBar::GetPulldown(char *n)
00865 {
00866   for(int i = 0; i < menu_count; i++) {
00867     if(strcmp(menu_items[i]->getname(), n) == 0) 
00868       return menu_items[i];
00869   }
00870   return NULL;
00871 }
00872 
00873 /*
00874 ** Method Description:
00875 **   XMMenuBar::GetMenuItem  - Searches the menu hiearchy attached to this
00876 **                             menu bar for a match with a widget name.
00877 ** Formal Parameters:
00878 **   char *n:
00879 **     Name of the widget to hunt for.
00880 ** Returns:
00881 **    Pointer to the XMMenuItem which describes the menu item or NULL if
00882 **    there is no match in the menu hierarchy.
00883 **/
00884 
00885 XMMenuItem *XMMenuBar::GetMenuItem(char *n)
00886 {
00887   XMMenuItem *theone;
00888 
00889   for(int i = 0; i < menu_count; i++) {
00890     theone = menu_items[i]->FindMenuItem(n);
00891     if(theone) 
00892       return theone;
00893   }
00894   return NULL;
00895 
00896 }
00897 
00898 /*
00899 ** Method Description:
00900 **   XMMenuBar::GetNextPulldown  - This method iterates through the pulldown
00901 **                                 menu list associated with the menu bar
00902 **                                 and returns the next pulldown
00903 ** Returns:
00904 **   XMPulldown * pointer to the next pulldown or NULL If there aren't any more
00905 */
00906 XMPulldown *XMMenuBar::GetNextPulldown()
00907 {
00908   XMPulldown *here;
00909 
00910   if(menu_cursor < menu_count) {
00911     here = menu_items[menu_cursor];
00912     menu_cursor++;
00913   }
00914   else
00915     here = NULL;
00916   return here;
00917 }
